metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1379 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The signal handler implementations in socat before 1.7.3.0 and 2.0.0-b8 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (process freeze or crash). It was discovered that socat incorrectly handled signals. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1379` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

socat - 1.7.2.3-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: socat package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.7.2.3-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
